required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Better Arterial Cannulation Technique With Different Hemodynamics
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Conventional and Ultrasound Guided Techniques of Radial Artery Cannulation in Different Hemodynamic Subsets: a Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose Two techniques of radial artery cannulation, ultrasound guided (USG) and conventional method (CM) were compared to find the better technique in general and in different hemodynamic subsets of patients.
Method This is a prospective randomized, single center study of 100 patients. The details of the primary cannulation technique, number of attempts, time taken, failure and cross-over technique were recorded for three different hemodynamic subsets with Systolic blood pressure <80 mm hg, 80-100 mm hg and > 100 mm hg.

primary_outcome.description: First pass success rate depicted the better method of cannulation of radial artery

primary_outcome.measure: Final/ultimate success rate of an intervention
primary_outcome.description: If the primary technique failed then the cannulation was done with the secondary technique and hence the final success rate was calculated for each of the techniques: conventional and ultrasound guided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken for the respective technique
secondary_outcome.description: Time taken for each technique was calculated from start of needle insertion till the cannula was completely inserted. The time was compared between the two arms
Number of attempts made by a technique was recorded and compared

arm_group.description: Radial artery cannulation has been done using the conventional method. Cannulation failure with this technique were tried with USG technique secondarily.
Radial artery cannulation is done with ultrasound guidance for this group of patients. Cannulation failure with this technique were tried with Conventional technique secondarily.

intervention.description: Radial artery cannulation done with conventional and ultrasound guidance in two respective groups of patients and their first pass success and ultimate success rates compared in different hemodynamic subsets of the patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult Patients worthy of radial artery cannulation, who consented
Exclusion Criteria:
- No consent
